name: Charity Tax Group
goal:
The Charity Tax Group (CTG) has over 600 members of all sizes representing all types of charitable activity. CTG was set up in 1982 to make representations to Government on charity taxation and it has since become the leading voice for the sector on this issue.

Through CTG, you can:

* be part of the sector's leading authority on tax and charities
* help to reduce the sector's irrecoverable VAT bill - now Â£1 billion a year
* improve tax concessions on giving
* identify new ways of helping the sector
interests: Budget, Business and Industry, Culture, Customs, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Institutional affairs, Taxation
euInitiatives: Taxation and topics related to charities particularly in respect of VAT reform
